revised_title: An Account of the Eclipse of the Sun, April 1, 1764: Observations and Calculations
tldr: The author, James Ferguson, provides an account of the solar eclipse on April 1, 1764, and discusses the calculations and observations related to the event. He explains the differences between mean and true times of the eclipse and the importance of accurate calculations for predicting future eclipses. Ferguson also presents tables detailing the eclipse's progression and the effects of the Sun and Moon's unequal motions on the timing of future eclipses.
